ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Knowledge of the role of journalism, some writing and editing skills, practiced sourcing

Great opportunity to practice long-form journalism. You get to dive deep into a topic and produce really rewarding work; plus Professor Brill is great and the readings are interesting/worthwhile. I learned a ton about journalism as an industry/business model, how to convince sources to speak to me, how to craft an effective story, etc.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The biggest strength of the class is its assignments (which can be intense and time-consuming) and the feedback you will get on them. The biggest weakness was low engagement in discussions during class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Brill is very knowledgeable of journalism and has a lot of experience and connections. We read interesting journalistic pieces, practiced our writing, and discussed various aspects of journalism. People in class were very experienced in journalism (as for college students) as well. Brill can be intimidating at times, and the workload is on the heavier side, but the class is worth it. If you put in work, you will get a lot from it.

Yes, the course assignments are so unique and interesting. I really enjoyed being able to go really in-depth on a topic of my choosing and work with an article over the course of multiple months, plus the classmate profile is such an interesting (and sort of odd but totally worthwhile) assignment.
